channel.title: How to rob a bank
channel.description:
Hypothetically if you were to have the resources to rob a bank how would you do it.
[b]Rules of The Robbery[/b]
[ul][li]There can be five or fewer people on you team[/li] [li]You must have a get away plan[/li] [li]The robbery can be done at any time, day or night[/li] [li]You can kill as many or as few people as you like[/li][/ul]

item.title: How to rob a bank
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“yakman, post:10, topic:298581”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=394972.msg2935681#msg2935681 date=1251548947]
i wouldnt, id rob somewhere less secure that holds high volumes of money

en.wikipedia.org

Securitas depot robbery

Jetmir Bucpapa (life) Roger Coutts (life) Emir Hysenaj (20 years) Lee Murray (25 years) Stuart Royle (life) The Securitas depot robbery was the largest cash robbery in British history. It took place on the evening of 21 February 2006 from 18:30 GMT until the early hours of 22 February 2006. Several men abducted and threatened the family of the manager, tied up fourteen staff members and stole £53,116,760 in bank notes from a Securitas Cash Management Ltd depot in Vale Road, Tonbridge, Kent. ...


[/quote]

A wikipedia link! How annoying! I must flame…[/quote]

Huh? I just figured if I said “the 06 securitas robbery”, not everyone would know what I was talking about Especially non brits…

Read full topic

item.title: How to rob a bank
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Uriko:

I would wait until the last few minutes the bank is closing, they unlocked the door one day and let me in at closing and they had STACKS of $5 bills and other bills on the counters. (By stacks I mean like 3 bricks of money together)

Similar thing happened here when the phone lines went down. They couldn’t access bank accounts but they were willing to let people withdraw up to $200 and they had stacks of $20 at the desk

Read full topic

item.title: How to rob a bank
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Davidude:

Don’t most bank vaults have timed locks? That’d suck anus.

Most do. But that also means that they can’t access it to deposit money. Or perhaps they have a small chute for money to pass through. Anyways, if you know when the locks can be opened, you can plan your robbery.

Read full topic

item.title: How to rob a bank
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Alright I invested a lot of money at this small bank, but the bank is for wealthy people. They pay out high interest rates (4.5% compounded monthly) for accounts with a lot of money in them.

Everytime I go in there’s no one inside. There’s just 1 office, and 2 ladies at the counter. No one occupies the office unless there is a customer I guess. And the manager is in an office behind the desk. I’ve never seen a customer inside this bank, though I’ve only been there three times.

I’d bring 1 friend. Have a gun each, maybe your partner could have a shotgun or automatic weapon. Snort a fat line of blow, this is essential. You walk in, say your demands on a piece of paper and partially show your gun. Perhaps your friend could do it to the other lady at the same time. Get your friend to watch them at the front. Now you hurry the heck up to the managers office and immediately hold him up. Demand the keys to the vault (or however the fuck banks store money in this day and age). If he does anything funny kill him and get the keys off the ladies at the front. If he doesn’t do anything funny, bring him back to your friend to keep them held up.

Go grab the cash, and you both run out. Then run around the side of the building to the field. The grass is taller then your head and very thick. Run up a bit to forest-ish area and there is a dirt path that leads to a dirt road dead end street where I would keep my car parked. Snort another line and go home. We should have like 10 minutes till police get there.

But really if I was gonna rob a place, it would be Bingo Country. Way easier, and huge cash prizes.

Read full topic
